bow: have you ever sent your kiddo alone on plane so my ex husband moved to phoenix and in dallas he used to love hours away so we would just drive and half hours to meet he moved about months ago and this summer our 11 year old will be flying alone to him am freaking out neither of us have been on plane she told me she is scared and she excited to go my ex told me there is going to be flight attendant with her at all times he paid more for that he says she will board first and last ca leave til her plane leaves and she wo be handed off without my ex or his wife presenting their id everything sounds good and in order but my anxiety is thru the roof hate hate hate the thought of her afraid and alone on plane my mom and fiance said the worst part is take off and hate knowing wo be there to hold her hand also afraid of some freak accident happening although know it safer up there than in car some days thinking about it want to cry ok know being to dramatic but being truthful have any of all sent kiddo alone any advice or happy stories will be nice have but my parents divorced when was baby so took many plane rides by myself since they lived in different parts of the country loved it getting to fly in general was fun but as kid all the extra attention received made it even more fun did have flight attendant with me except on the plane although they would check often was the last to leave so usually got to walk out with the pilots and talk with them which was kind of like meeting the president when was kid and thought pilots had one of the coolest jobs ever lol does she like thrill rides if she can handle those at amusement parks she ll probably enjoy take off and landing those are the best parts make sure she has things to do to keep her occupied and any documentation she may need enough money to buy snacks drinks at the airport if she wants anything otherwise the airlines are good about taking care of their young flyers my son flew by himself last summer 13yo it went super smoothly felt better because he had his phone and lots of people to call if needed in both take off and landing locations we have student at our school who does this unaccompanied minor thing every other weekend do ask me how the parents afford that but the kid has enough travel miles to get round trip from europe to hawaii my parents are divorced too and live in different countries flew to and from england and finland alone once when was around 11 12 was with someone from when was left by my parent till was in my seat then they checked on me many times during the flight and was with someone after landing till my other parent showed their passport to collect me really enjoyed it felt really grown up hope this makes sense and helps little yes my daughters flew from virginia to massachusetts years ago at ages and we told the airline exactly who was allowed to pick them up on the other side they were given lanyards with their names and phone numbers for each adult dropping off and picking up took them to the gate they were boarded first they were seated up front for the flight attendant to keep an eye on them at the destination they were escorted off by airline personnel and delivered in person to their grandparents who were at the gate airline personnel checked ids before the kids were released the same process for the return was very comfortable with the entire process ok thank you do know anyone who has done it so all the positive responses are so nice to hear they re putting my worries to rest thank you loving these first hand stories it really putting my worries to rest it sad how scared am yet my daughter is telling everyone she going alone guess it does make her feel grown up haha nice my ex has joked that she gon na earn ton of free miles even though dallas and phoenix are that far apart know this is just going to become norm in her life so got ta prepare for that she does love roller coasters am absolutely terrified of heights she got her brave side from her dad that for sure thank you for the tips bought her noise cancellation ear phones and stocked her phone with movies know it short flight but she has short attention span lol thank you again was sure if she be able to call anyone jeez sound like caveman just learning of flight lol that good to know sure ll call so much she ll start sending me to voicemail thank you my then 8yo flew solo last year it was with air canada he had special unaccompanied minor ticket which meant he was escorted from drop off to pick up seated at the very front row of the plane and released only to the adult named on the ticket id was checked he loved it and is responsible enough that had no qualms with him literally flying solo he apparently slept ate all the snacks and read books on his tablet his seat mate was also solo kid bottom line follow whichever airline unaccompanied minor regulations make sure your kid is prepared and comfortable it ll all be just fine the airline biggest nightmare would be losing or hurting your kid their job is to keep him safe wanted also the traveling kid but only my first trip as long as she bit independent she ll be fine just make sure you check the age cut offs for them accompanying her when was 14 got off the plane and asked where the people were who normally walks you out apparently at 14 they no longer did that so was solo from that point on she ll be fine my nieces flew from germany to the us by them selves when they were amp respectively granted they were experienced flyers but given you will get to take her to the gate she should be fine as confident your daughter is an experienced seat filler also is that long of flight just make sure she has something to occupy her on the flight book or tablet etc maybe some snacks it will be great experience for her as she grows up in more global world did it when was 10 and it was so fun even had layover and got to go to special room with tvs and toys sure takeoff and landing was different than being in the air but it helped lot that everyone around me was calm and didn pay much attention to it think that made it more exciting than scary flew by myself several times as kid was no big deal at all actually had fun and felt like had some independence or something my stepdaughter lives with us and has been flying alone since she was my parents are divorced and would also fly alone when was around that age loved it it was nice to feel like an independent traveler even though there were always flight attendants responsible for me my stepdaughter likes it too although think she may get little bored my 12 year old flys as an unaccompanied minor from california to new jersey and back 2x year that hour flight and he never had any issues the flight attendants are always super nice to him and give him extra drinks and snacks and he never complained about any of his flights what airline are you sending her on flew on plane alone for the first time at really enjoyed it and the flight attendants were awesome no problem and if you do already know you can try to request gate pass from the airline which will allow you to go through security and take her back to the gate so you can see her board they should give you one without problem hope she has good flight flight attendant here we have unaccompanied minors all the time it not true that fa is with them at all times it just an extra fee to have them travel alone in general they board first we greet them verify with them who is picking them up where they re going etc sit them down and brief them on who their crew is where the call button is if they need anything and then brief them on the safety stuff we always have side eye watching them and usually try to make sure it female to female sitting next to them or male to male etc year olds do it like pros all day long your 11 year old will be pro bet as well we also take them off first and check the id of the caregiver picking them off sign them off and there they go ps from phx and now live in dal if you have other questions let me know maybe ll be her fa haha will do thanks ve personally flown by myself overseas back and forth between australia and the us since was about 12 or 13 up until was around 16 or 17 was considered an unaccompanied minor and was always in the best care thanks to the airlines think mainly flew qantas but also flew american airlines united for shorter connecting flights never had any issues and was treated amazingly they even bumped me up to first class on one of the long haul flights they held onto my passport took me to the front of queues and let me board the plane first would wait until everyone got off and they would take me through customs everything and whoever was picking me up had to sign for me was pretty shy cautious child growing up and always felt comfortable by the time wasn considered an accompanied minor anymore even though didn get the special treatment didn need it felt like total seasoned veteran and knew exactly what to do myself🤗 do this all the time since my son was his grandma moved out of state and since they are so close send him out for spring breaks and part of summer it fine also did it as kid at least four times on 6+hour flights she won get lost they are very careful about that most kids love it it exciting and empowering if she gets window seat it an amazing view last month flew my yr old nephew out to visit unaccompanied and he never even been on plane before he was nervous leaving his mom but so calm and confident on the way home like an old pro let her know how much you trust in her to behave on the plane and remember instructions and she ll rise to the occasion when my son turned 12 he grew out of the unaccompanied status and now he flies like an adult without the careful id checks and handoff we ve never had so much as hiccup was child of divorce and my parents had me fly alone all the time starting when was quite young they are both immigrants to the us so they regularly sent me from the west coast to europe to visit family and never had any issues they would also send me between different foreign countries so vacation time could overlap flew alone all the time as kid it was back before the days of stewardesses escorting you everywhere too absolutely thought it was cool adventure your daughter will be fine as will you flew when was 13 and was in charge of my two younger siblings the attendants were with me every step of the way even when we had to change planes they were there if she excited let her take this big step on her own it will build so much self confidence and will be something she never forgets she is going to be absolutely fine my niece flew from seattle to san jose to visit us when she was my nephew flew from seattle to la to meet my parents for his 7th birthday they took him to disneyland he had blast the pilot texted his mom pic of my nephew sitting in the pilot seat in the cockpit it seriously not big deal and your daughter will be fine plan something that will distract you while she on the flight so you aren checking your phone every 10 seconds have been kid alone plane on plane at ages 13 cross country flights to visit family it was super fun got to wear button and the flight attendants are always right with you got extra peanuts and special attention she wo be able to make phone calls while in the air but she could before takeoff and after landing have but little advice send gun with her both ways tell the to start chewing right before take off and landing it will help with the pressure difference good luck as former nanny used to take two boys and to lax every other friday to get on plane and fly to vegas to be with their dad they loved it especially the mcdonalds they ate at the airport it will be fine went when was 16 and my leg was in cast they definitely treated me like kid alone flight attendants always asking if was okay they took me everywhere needed to go however not sure how much of that was because they wheelchaired me around and how much because was minor haven sent my child on flight by herself but had the same experience as your daughter used to fly across country regularly to visit my dad used to think it was the coolest thing ever getting to act like an adult used to go to the back where the flight attendants were and ask for extra pop and snacks haha don recall ever being scared on flight and always felt taken care of watched over make sure she packs books movies music whatever to keep her busy was flying by myself since was seven or eight and thought it was so much fun hopefully your daughter will have an equally awesome time can imagine how nerve wracking it is from parents perspective but from the kids perspective it was pretty damn cool haha had to reread this few times before realized you meant gum not gun did it as kid and it was good experience for me was ten pretty sure let my son travel somewhere on his own when he around or 10 and one of my best friend son who is 10 just went from florida to peru by himself flew alone when was with no assistance my parents would pay extra it was great have sent my kid but ve flown with single kids on flights ve talked to the moms to see what it is like the moms get to go all the way to the gate this mom even was able to take her onto the plane the kid was always with the flight attendant even escorted to the bathroom obviously not in the bathroom watched the child be handed to her dad and yeah he did have to show id it seemed incredibly safe the kid even got extra treats and sodas it was cute hahha wow thank you for the catch definitely did mean gun hey wanted to say that it okay to be afraid of things that we don know or understand you re did great by asking for experiences and hopefully this thread has eased your mind bet that youtube has at least handful of videos of kids flying alone it might help her to know what to expect yes 1st when he was have all the documentation ready at both ends its good that they re so strict but it means you have to follow their instructions to the he traveled plenty to feel comfortable amp said it was no big deal sure he zoned out as if were sitting right next to him happy travels my son is 38 and flew across country alone when he was and as far as know does not suffer from ptsd flight attendants should more than have this kids of divorced parents thing down to science by now it summer they ll clump all the little kids shuttling from one parent to the other together lpt for everone else do book flight the first week of summer vacation if you can help it when was little would go to my dad up in alaska from the states it was not only day in the air but often at least one stop over and flight change without parent there this was 20 yrs ago so sure parts are done differently but the stewards were great and made sure was okay at all times also if there were other kids also flying alone they swap our seats so we could play the thing wanted to tell you is send letter letters for your child to receive when she at her dad my mom had to write them and send them starting before even left home back then because alaska is far and us postal mail is slow but idk if you ll need to do that she knew loved confetti and sure liked the idea that my dad would have to clean it up so she stuffed all the envelopes with it to make the experience even more fun lastly note about emotional reactions my mom and noticed after the first couple trips that we would have big fight right before left in order to make my leaving more bearable just be prepared for some not quite conscious but definitely purposeful distance right before leaving love the letter idea she grown up in time of emails but she loves sending cards letters thru the mail especially since we love hours from our closest relative thank you for that idea and have noticed that she little moody toward my fiance more than usual think she sometimes feels guilty for loving him before she visits dad the first time flew alone on plane was years old my parents divorced when was and my mom moved from central us to virginia mom came to get me in her car and flew back alone to my dad had so much fun was given books to read on the plane maybe had my gameboy but can remember and the flight attendants were super nice to me they would give me snacks and checked on me often and the lady sat next to was also super nice just sat there and hung out for the ride but had been on plane before and knew the drill it will definitely depend on your kiddo temperament but truly enjoyed it lol aw well thanks it is comforting knowing there is clump of kids like her going so they know how to deal with them this is our first year but ll take that bit of advice about not sending her the first week into next year use to fly to my dad all the time as kid it seriously some of my fondest memories would chat with the cool people next to me and the staff would be amazing with me got to feel super special and there was always someone there with me if things got scary she ll be totally fine documentation in the confirmation emails and instructions emails they did specify that just ds or birth certificates do think my ex has copy of her birth certificate thank you felt foolish being so afraid but everyone helpful comments has truly brought my worries to rest suffer from anxiety and this trip has been driving me insane with worry but these responses have helped thank you and everyone for the kind words and advice yay love reading these replies she beyond excited to fly alone so pretty sure she gon na have as much fun as you and others have stated haha lol got it thankfully read the edit before sent her with gun will she be able to use her phone for movies and music during flight flew as um when was 11 14 it was cool the flight attendants paid special attention to me and at one point in chicago my flight was super delayed so they brought me to this cool room to watch movie and bought me mcdonalds also during one of my trips remember plane being held up only so that could make my layover the airport staff takes it super seriously myself had divorced parents and flew solo from about years old until was 17 honestly it was lot of fun and never felt scared the flight attendants always sat me in the front row by their carts and swear almost always sat next to teacher who asked me million questions about school and my summer plans it might make you feel better to fly somewhere with her the first time since you mention you ve never flown for her sake try not to let your anxieties become her anxieties at 11 am sure this feels like mini adventure and tiny dose of adulthood it did for me now my mom brain have year old and newborn and am quite certain would be anxious about them flying even at 11 years old can give you advice based on my experience as child but as parent of course you are anxious you sound like wonderful mother do what you can to prepare her and you and am certain it will all go so smoothly you will both be pros in no time yeah this kid has been doing it for the last years so it is very normal now to the point that it is remarked upon or anything it was little challenging to begin with as mum dropped him off at school ready to go after school complete with passport and we were initially sure what we were supposed to do about making sure he did lose it during the school day it all runs like clockwork now ve been the kid about 18 years ago would be first on first off but the attendant did not stay the whole time with me they would frequently check on me but that it they would walk me on and off hope that helps now sure how it is nowadays just started this last year my daughter who is now 10 flies up to minnesota from phoenix as an unaccompanied minor to visit her dada side of the family for summer was freaking out at first as well but my daughter loved it she had awesome attendants which made it easier for myself and her dad she leaves in couple weeks 😭😭 it just expensive and could cover another adults ticket easily yes they may request it be in airplane mode no data but she can definitely watch and listen to stuff she downloaded earlier depending on the airline they may have an app that connects to their in flight entertainment for watching free movies shows after the take off period there might even be in flight wifi but it often an extra fee and kind of expensive for my heavy phone usage while traveling like to bring an external battery pack so can recharge if needed flew by myself many times as child starting when was my parents would send me to visit my grandparents across the country loved it the flight attendants were super nice and helpful had great experiences every time yep the separation anxiety has got ta be common have done it my kiddo was and it went absolutely fine the same attendant takes them from gate to gate so there is no chance for her to get lost and it can be really great experience let the attendant know that it her first time on plane they are usually good with the kids it sounds like you re bit anxious about flying in general be wary of your daughter picking up on that too much my best friend and flew from memphis to dallas when we were 12 and 13 we did have any issues the whole way and southwest airlines made sure that we were safe flight attendant greeted us at both gates and made sure we sat in the back with them for the flight this was in the 90 but would hope the process is even more secure now oh she good going the first week was just making joke that regular adult travelers might not want to fly that week lol ve flown that week lot and do mind but people often complain about kids on planes am and ve been really good at hiding it from her know if she sees me freak out then she ll freak out this thread has seriously calmed my nerves great deal thank you the first hand experience responds is so nice to hear on the airline we used as an example all of the information on the form filled out had to match my mom id not just name but also address think she also had to have copy of the form the airline will explain their guidelines have not but would be comfortable doing it with my year old as long as there was responsible trustworthy adult on the other end to pick her up she consider it an adventure
